1:
My son, do not forget my commands
\q and keep my teachings in your heart,
\q
2:
for length of days and years of life
\q and peace they will add to you.
3:
Do not let covenant faithfulness and trustworthiness ever leave you,
\q tie them together about your neck,
\q write them on the tablet of your heart.
\q
4:
Then you will find favor and a good reputation
\q in the sight of God and man.
6:
in all your ways acknowledge him
\q and he will make your paths straight.
8:
It will be healing to your flesh
\q and refreshment for your body.
9:
Honor Yahweh with your wealth
\q and with the firstfruits of all your produce,
\q
10:
and your storehouses will be filled up
\q and your vats will be bursting, full of new wine.
11:
My son, do not despise Yahweh's instruction
\q and do not hate his rebuke,
\q
12:
for Yahweh disciplines those he loves,
\q as a father deals with a son who pleases him.
14:
What you gain from wisdom is better than what silver will give in return
\q and its profit is better than gold.
15:
Wisdom is more precious than jewels
\q and nothing you desire can compare to her.
\q
16:
She has length of days in her right hand;
\q in her left hand are riches and honor.
17:
Her ways are ways of kindness
\q and all her paths are peace.
\q
18:
She is a tree of life to those who take hold of it,
\q those who hold on to it are happy.
19:
By wisdom Yahweh founded the earth,
\q by understanding he established the heavens.
\q
20:
By his knowledge the depths broke open
\q and the clouds dropped their dew.
21:
My son, keep sound judgment and discernment,
\q and do not lose sight of them.
\q
22:
They will be life to your soul
\q and an adornment of favor to wear around your neck.
24:
when you lie down, you will not be afraid;
\q when you lie down, your sleep will be sweet.
25:
Do not be afraid of sudden terror
\q or devastation caused by the wicked, when it comes,
\q
26:
for Yahweh will be on your side
\q and will keep your foot from being caught in a trap.
27:
Do not withhold good from those who deserve it,
\q when it is in your power to act.
\q
28:
Do not say to your neighbor,
\q "Go, and come again, and tomorrow I will give it,"
\q when you have the money with you.
29:
Do not make a plan to harm your neighborâ€”
\q the one who lives close and trusts you.
\q
30:
Do not argue with a person without a reason,
\q when he has done nothing to harm you.
31:
Do not envy a violent person
\q or choose any of his ways.
\q
32:
For the devious person is detestable to Yahweh,
\q but he brings the upright person into his confidence.
33:
The curse of Yahweh is on the house of the wicked person,
\q but he blesses the home of righteous people.
\q
34:
He mocks mockers,
\q but he gives his favor to humble people.
35:
Wise people inherit honor,
\q but fools will be lifted up in their shame.
